programme.desc: Jennifer says Josh's lies have serious impacts. He sold her car and dumped her dog while she was giving birth.

programme.desc: Stevisha and Rahbert’s relationship was a secret. They were found out when Stevisha got pregnant.

programme.desc: Taylore and Ravaun met online and married shortly after. Taylore claims Ravaun is hooking up with other women.

programme.desc: Miranda wants Chase to stop abandoning her so they can be a family with their new baby.

programme.desc: Willie says Naomi cheated and is not good enough. Naomi says Willie had a 2 year affair and the trust is gone.

programme.desc: Dwight says Roxy's harassment has gotten him fired. She says he needs to give her more attention!

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Mario is suing the neighborhood psychic, Lydia, after promising to remove his curse...for a fee.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Miguel is suing his ex-girlfriend for the entire $5 million which she won via a scratch-off ticket.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Jonah sues ex-friend Elliot for $25,000, defamation, and IP theft, aiming to disband "The Wizarding Warband." Elliot disputes, blaming Jonah's leadership for league decline.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Samantha sues Elizabeth and PI Ricardo for $40,000 over false accusations. Elizabeth hired Ricardo to investigate Samantha's husband but wrongly accused Samantha. Samantha claims harassment, and defamation. Elizabeth and Ricardo deny responsibility.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Maddy sues Vanessa for theft and emotional distress, seeking $300,000. Their IVF journey soured due to suspicions of cheating and missing money. Vanessa claims shared IVF funds; Maddy discovered an affair with Tyler, a mutual friend.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Giselle is suing her father for Emotional Distress and $145,000 for the cost of canceling her wedding.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Ariana Garcia, 19, is suing her parents for refusal to acknowledge and respect her privacy and boundaries.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Damien sues Sal for $35 million, alleging Sal's car service ruined his marrage by dropping his wife at his mistress' house. Sal denies fault, prioritizing business growth.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Annie sues ex-best friend Olivia for $150K emotional distress. Olivia, once maid of honor, hijacked wedding plans, changing venue and dresses. Annie feels betrayed, removed Olivia from bridal party. Olivia defends, says she improved wedding.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Daniel sues Jeremy for $800,000, alleging copyright infringement over "Nightshade Ninja" costume copied as "Shadow Shogun." Jeremy denies, claims originality, forgives Daniel for reputation damage.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Alexa is suing her boyfriend for abruptly canceling a trip of a lifetime because she needed to bring her kid.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Gabriella is suing her former employer for $600,000 for mental anguish and wrongful termination.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Michael Brown sues Victor Hernandez, "Savage Skin" tattoo shop owner, for $50,000, alleging Victor maliciously altered his tattoo design due to a grudge over dating Victor's ex, causing an embarrassing tattoo. Victor says it's a misunderstanding.

programme.title: The People's Court
programme.sub-title: You Threw Me Out Of Your Taxi
programme.desc: Allison is suing the taxi driver she hired to drive her home after a medical procedure for kicking her out.

programme.title: The People's Court
programme.desc: Christina is suing someone she's known for 8 years over money she claims he owes her for a French bulldog.

programme.title: The People's Court
programme.desc: Hasani and Toni say they bought a very large speaker from the defendant, Armando, with the understanding they’d get their money. Back if they couldn’t find a truck to transport it - which ended up happening. They claim the Armando gave them some cockamamie story that a man showed up to pick it up for them. Armando says the plaintiffs said they’d be sending someone to pick it up. That same day a tall guy came with the same receipt and picked up the speaker. Then he gets a call from the bank saying the charge is being disputed. He claims this is an absurd shakedown and he is accused of making a lot of noise.

programme.title: The People's Court
programme.desc: Plaintiff Mumena Boru accuses her ex, Angelo Woodard, of breaking into her apartment, stealing her TV, and taking her phone. Angelo claims the TV is his and countersues for $5,000, alleging wasted time and emotional distress.

programme.title: Judge Mathis
programme.desc: Irma demands a refund for the party bus she rented from LaToya, stating it wasn't decorated properly.

programme.title: Judge Mathis
programme.desc: Christopher is sued by his mother for parking tickets after being unable to forgive her for choosing drugs.

programme.title: Judge Mathis
programme.desc: A mother claims her son punched her in the face three times after getting into an argument and then put her in a choke hold; her son claims he was only acting in self-defense.

programme.title: Judge Mathis
programme.desc: Jorge brings his wife to court for damaged property after constantly accusing him of cheating.

programme.title: Judge Mathis
programme.desc: The plaintiff says that, two years ago, her mother confessed that the defendant may be her biological father, so she has petitioned the court for a paternity test.

programme.desc: Jeretha is petitioning the court for a DNA test to be given to a woman she thinks is her sister.

programme.title: Judge Mathis
programme.desc: Ansyl is suing his former tenant for two months' rent saying she was working as a prostitute while renting.

programme.title: Judge Mathis
programme.desc: A man sues his ex-fiance for unreturned property and an engagement ring; she says she left him because he's a raging alcoholic and drug addict.

programme.desc: Exes squabble in court over who’s to blame for their failed relationship.

programme.desc: Demario and Necole’s relationship is tested when he tries to impose his conservative Christian values onto her.

programme.desc: Married couple Jovan and Rosalyn feud over a shredded sofa, a broken TV and a dead plant.

programme.desc: Secret social accounts and suspicious behavior have Kashmir asking the Cutlers if this relationship can be saved.

programme.desc: A Georgia couple seek advice from the judges after struggling with nitpicking, job loss and starting a family.
